stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream importing and troubleshooting Biobak’s big re-work of Course 10 (internal name “C10”).  Work focuses on integrating new geometry (candy-themed temple interior), a completely new Yoshi model, decorative bushes, a sliding trap-floor, and assorted actors while hunting down visual, collision and performance bugs.

development_findings.summary: A repeat "texture has too many colors / material 242" error was traced to duplicate texture names; renaming the duplicate immediately fixed it.
development_findings.quote: We fixed this yesterday—turns out we had two textures with the same name. Okay, this is fixable.

development_findings.summary: Kaze reports the engine is nearing bug-free status and the compiler now builds with zero warnings; the codebase is strictly 32-bit to avoid GCC inserting 64-bit ops that break on real hardware.
development_findings.quote: I am slowly approaching zero engine bugs… I actually got my entire compiler down to zero warnings as well.

development_findings.summary: Performance optimisation: actors execute in name order, so Kaze renamed objects so identical behaviours sit next to each other in memory, improving instruction-cache locality.  Tests show Mario’s behaviour loop never drops from cache.
development_findings.quote: Just by ordering them right… my game by itself is already so optimised that Mario’s behaviour loop never gets thrown out of cache.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rejects entity-component systems, claiming static ordering and direct function calls are far faster on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: Entity component system is complete garbage… just gel the function you want to gel and order the actors correctly in memory.

development_findings.summary: Lighting technique: all static geometry uses vertex colours (primitive colour modulation) instead of shadow textures; environment colour is avoided due to a Fast64 bug.
development_findings.quote: We always use primitive colour when we can. That way we can bake lighting right away and it’s strictly superior for static geometry.

development_findings.summary: New Yoshi model from Biobak required re-hooking the armature, fixing missing tongue animation, adding proper collision and changing an OBJ-list flag; interaction now works but a double-dialogue bug remains.
development_findings.quote: I knew it. He's fixed… He still talks twice—that’s for later.

development_findings.summary: New, larger donut boss model broke because two textures were assigned in one cycle (illegal on N64); removing the extra texture and scaling the model down ~28 % restored correct behaviour.
development_findings.quote: Two textures in one cycle—illegal operation. Easy fix.

development_findings.summary: Grass overhang seams on real N64 caused Z-fighting; Kaze physically extended the mesh so the seam is hidden.
development_findings.quote: I had to make the grass actually hang over here so that this just disappears.

development_findings.summary: Decorative "TempoBush" objects now get slight hue and brightness variation via primitive-colour multipliers; outlines were reduced and height lowered into the ground for better animation.
development_findings.quote: It randomly picks a colour between this and this, so they all look slightly different.

development_findings.summary: Sliding trap floor: new mechanic slides sideways instead of collapsing; requires two mirrored instances and separate collision exports after unnecessary underside geometry was removed to save triangles.
development_findings.quote: Mirroring the collision isn’t simple, so I’ll just export two collisions—collision data is cheap.

development_findings.summary: Because room layouts shifted, Kaze started rebuilding collision maps; OBJ-list spawner collision is being phased out in favour of explicit maps for reliability.
development_findings.quote: If I want this to be playable at all with everything moved around, I have to make a collision map.

context_findings.summary: Zeina (Kaze’s spouse) has ‘banished’ him to work in the basement—mentioned light-heartedly.
context_findings.quote: Where I am there isn’t much heat because I am in the basement—Zeina’s banished me here.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prides himself on visuals, claiming the project is the best looking N64 game ever.
context_findings.quote: I don’t think you can even make the case that there’s a better looking N64 game than this.

context_findings.summary: Programming worldview: only assembly and high-level languages matter; everything in between is ‘mental illness’.
context_findings.quote: There’s only two programming languages—assembly and high-level. Anything after that is mental illness.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with Windows 11 when taskbar freezes, requiring Task Manager reset.
context_findings.quote: Fucking Windows 11, I guess… had to restart Windows Explorer.

context_findings.summary: Merchandise launch: TeePublic store with course-specific shirts and mugs; YouTube linking takes two days.
context_findings.quote: We now have a new merch store on TeePublic…but apparently it takes two days for it to connect.

context_findings.summary: Community event plan: F3 2025 will be sponsored, with a user-vote cash reward for the most popular release.
context_findings.quote: Since this is a sponsored event this time, the most popular game gets a cash reward on the day they release.

biobak.summary: Delivered a substantial Course 10 asset overhaul, including geometry, textures, new Yoshi model, bushes, and sliding trap-floor; provided a detailed changelog Kaze imported.
Actively gives real-time feedback on colour intensity, outlines and lighting of his bush and floor assets during the stream.
biobak.quote: A little too bright—at most as bright as the grass. …You could fix the outlines, but you didn’t.

zeina.summary: No direct development input this stream; mentioned only in a personal context (she moved Kaze’s workspace).

key_stories.title: Duplicate texture bug resurfaces
key_stories.summary: While importing Biobak’s files, the exporter halts on ‘material 242’ for having too many colours. Kaze realises two textures share the same name—a problem supposedly fixed the day before—and corrects it by renaming, allowing the build to proceed.
key_stories.challenge: Export fails with a cryptic ‘too many colours’ error.
key_stories.process: Inspected texture list, spotted duplicate name, renamed offending file and re-exported.
key_stories.outcome: Level now exports; Kaze documents issue for future hygiene.
key_stories.key_quote: We literally fixed this yesterday—how can this be an issue? Wait… two textures with the same name. Okay, this is fixable.

key_stories.title: Integrating the new Yoshi
key_stories.summary: Biobak’s upgraded Yoshi model looks great but ships without proper armature links, collision, or some animations. Kaze re-assigns weights, fixes collision flags and animation timing. Interaction now works, though a double-dialogue quirk persists.
key_stories.challenge: Model exports but lacks collision and loses mouth-opening animation; Yoshi talks twice and can’t eat shy-guys.
key_stories.process: Hooked up armature, edited vertex groups, toggled ‘OBJ list spawner’ to ‘surface’, patched animation frame logic.
key_stories.outcome: Yoshi functional enough to enter his interior; remaining dialogue bug deferred.
key_stories.key_quote: We fixed him enough to where we can go into him—that’s all we needed.

key_stories.title: Cache-friendly actor ordering
key_stories.summary: Kaze pursues extreme optimisation by renaming level actors so identical behaviours are stored contiguously in RAM, ensuring behaviour code fits in a single MIPS instruction-cache page.
key_stories.challenge: Minimise costly I-cache misses during gameplay.
key_stories.process: Renamed and re-ordered actors, ran cycle-counter tests to measure cache performance.
key_stories.outcome: Mario’s behaviour loop never ejects from cache; Kaze calls ECS ‘garbage’ and solidifies the strategy.
key_stories.key_quote: My game is already so optimised that Mario’s behaviour loop never gets thrown out of cache.

open_questions.context: After multiple fixes, Yoshi still opens the same dialogue twice when approached.
questions: What part of the behaviour script still triggers a second dialogue?
Is this related to recent object-list refactors?

open_questions.context: Biobak changed the collapsing floor to slide sideways; Kaze mirrored models and collision but is unsure about final alignment.
questions: Should the slide happen on both sides simultaneously or alternately?

open_questions.context: Primitive colour is now mandatory because of a Fast64 bug.
questions: What exactly breaks when environment colour is used?
Is there a path to re-enable it if Fast64 is patched?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions a cash-prize community event.
questions: Will Return to Yoshi’s Island participate or launch alongside it?
What criteria decide the cash award?

open_questions.context: A TeePublic store is live with course-themed shirts.
questions: How does the team navigate Nintendo’s IP while selling merch?
